question: When working on a school or work project, what is most important to you?

options.text: Everything should be organized
The project should be 100% unique
The project should clearly meet the need it was intended for
The project should be done quickly, so we can do other things.

question: Which of these topics most interests you?

options.text: Art or Design
Business or marketing
Math or Science
Theater or Debate

question: Let's pretend you already know how to code. How do you go about making your own software?

options.text: Ask people what kinds of problems they have until you find one that you think you can solve with what you build.
Tinker and play with things that interest you, like your hobbies, until you come up with something that sounds cool.
Get a business to hire you to automate their process and build something that makes it so you and they can earn more money.
Investigate new and emerging technologies to find out how they can be used to solve problems that were previously solved other ways.

question: If you were put in charge of making a science fair project, how do you do it?

options.text: Come up with something that interests you that no one else has tried, and try it.
Piece together other science projects, changing out specific pieces until it becomes something unique
Don't worry about being unique, we just need to make something that will actually work when you are done.
Try to find something to do with your friends, where everyone gets to participate.

question: I like to (mark all that apply):

options.text: Build things
Educate others
Find and define problems
Organize stuff
Figure out how things work
Tinker with computers/robotics
Draw, paint, or sculpt
Write stories
Experience new things or cultures
When people don't follow the rules
Being on teams where other people don't care as much as I do
Taking responsibility or leadership over other people's work
Doing the same task over and over
Having to do work when it is unclear what is expected of me
When my work or school won't let me take time off for hobbies or personal time

question: Which do you want most in a future job?

options.text: Freedcom and flexibility to do what you like outside of work
Doing things that are meaningful and change the world
Stability and security in your lifestyle and work habits
The excitement of working on something new and interesting

question: Your work is giving away $1000 and a promotion to anyone who can find a way to make the company better, and it will become their job to do so. Which best describes how YOU would do this?

options.text: Design a better work place that is more pleasant and happy for workers, improving their productivity and morale
Come up with a new product for the company to make and sell to emerging markets
Find inefficient people and processes and help them to organize things and create less waste
Automate some of the work that is being done and free up time for workers to move on to other important tasks
Clarify the goals of the business and educate workers to help everyone focus their energy on the tasks that will earn the company more money

question: Choose phrases that describe you well:

options.text: I like things to look good.
I love my phone, and I think apps are really cool and useful.
I'm always looking for the latest and greatest thing to try.
I think how businesses work and make money is fascinating.
If I have 4 hours to complete a project, I'll take 3 clearly planning what needs to be done.
I am organized and I like to keep things neat.
I get obsessed easily about things that I care about.
I am a good communicator and peacemaker.
